intro: Cypella aurinegra subsp. albipurpurata, commonly known as the white-purpurated cypella, is a rare and delicate plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or rocky crevices. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
